missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent recruits. Healthy heroes and Stormtroopers can retrieve recruits. A figure can only carry 1 recruit at a time.
{-} Rebel mission tokens represent exits. When a hero carrying a recruit enters a space containing an exit, the heroes claim that recruit's mission token by clicking on the exit and selecting "Claim Recruit".
{-} At the start of each round, the Empire claims each recruit currently carried by a Stormtrooper.
{-} The Rebels win when the heroes have claimed 5 recruits.
{-} The Rebels lose when the Empire has claimed 8 mission tokens, or when all the heroes are wounded.
missionProperties.campaignName: Luke Skywalker (Hero of the Rebellion) Figure Pack
missionProperties.repositionOverride: All except Stormtroopers: Block access to the exits.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

This is not the way this recruitment meeting was supposed to go. You don't know how, but the Imperials knew.

Now you have to get your potential new recruits out of danger before they are captures by stormtroopers, or worse...

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Deploy <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> (Hero of the Rebellion) to the red highlighted space. Heroes control <color="red">Luke Skywalker</color> (Hero of the Rebellion) as an ally.
{-} Place 1 neutral mission token on each green highlighted space.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent recruits. Healthy heroes and Stormtroopers can retrieve recruits. A figure can only carry 1 recruit at a time.
{-} Rebel mission tokens represent exits. When a hero carrying a recruit enters a space containing an exit, the heroes claim that recruit's mission token by clicking on the exit and selecting "Claim Recruit".
{-} At the start of each round, the Empire claims each recruit currently carried by a Stormtrooper.
{-} The Rebels win when the heroes have claimed 5 recruits.
{-} The Rebels lose when the Empire has claimed 8 mission tokens, or when all the heroes are wounded.

eventActions.shortText: Recruits rescued by the Rebels: (&Rebel Recruits&/5). Recruits detained by the Empire: (&Imperial Recruits&/8)
eventActions.longText: Recruits rescued by the Rebels: (&Rebel Recruits&/5). Recruits detained by the Empire: (&Imperial Recruits&/8)

events.eventText:
Blasting down troopers, you rendezvous with Luke and the others. Now with firsthand experience of the Empire's cruelty, a grim resolve settles into your new recruits. You have no doubt that they'll prove to be valuable in the future.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Rebel players choose one hero to receive the "The Ways of the Force" Reward card.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

With the growing Imperial presence and with most of the recruits already detained, you and Luke decide it best to cut your losses and slip out the back.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

You help usher the panicking recruit out of the cantina.

{-} The Rebels claim this mission token.

The Empire forces the recruits away, out of your reach.

{-} Discard each Imperial figure carrying a recruit. The Empire claims that recruit.
{-} Mark the figures as defeated in the app. They do not count as defeated for ability purposes, but do count towards Fame.

No recruits were detained by the Empire.

eventActions.mainText:
The Imperial soldiers tally their detainees.

How many Stormtroopers are carrying neutral mission tokens?

events.eventText:
You hear a deep, mechanical voice raised in anger. "I told you I wanted this done quickly with no complications! Now, I must do this myself."

The imposing figure of Darth Vader marches into the cantina, surrounded by the threatening red glow emanating from his lightsaber.

eventActions.mainText:
As you fall back to treat your wounds for a moment, the Empire uses the chance to detain some recruits.

How many activation tokens did the wounded Rebel possess? (If it was an ally, click "1".)

events.eventText:
The Empire detains one of your recruits.

{-} The Empire claims 1 recruit that is the farthest away from any Imperial figures and that is not currently carried..

The Empire detains two of your recruits.

{-} The Empire claims 2 recruits that are the farthest away from any Imperial figures and that are not currently carried.

eventActions.mainText:
As you fall back to treat your wounds for a moment, the Empire uses the chance to detain some recruits.

How many activation tokens did the wounded Rebel possess? (If it was an ally, click "1".)

mapEntities.mainText:
A small side door leads out of the cantina, into the streets of the town.

{-} When a hero carrying a recruit enters this space, the heroes claim that recruit's mission token by clicking on the exit and selecting "Claim Recruit".

A small side door leads out of the cantina, into the streets of the town.

{-} When a hero carrying a recruit enters this space, the heroes claim that recruit's mission token by clicking on the exit and selecting "Claim Recruit".

A pathway leads towards the desert, away from prying Imperial eyes.

{-} When a hero carrying a recruit enters this space, the heroes claim that recruit's mission token by clicking on the exit and selecting "Claim Recruit".

initialGroups.customInstructions:
{Q} Move 1 to attack {rebel}.
{A} Move 2 towards the closest non-retrieved recruit.
{A} Move 7 towards the closest non-retrieved recruit.
{-} Retrieve a recruit.
